value.title: 6 ways to go bananas with Column from Examples in Power BI
value.excerpt: Patrick is going bananas with these different ways that Column from Examples can help you shape your data without writing code in Power BI. This feature really helps you to be efficient!  Download the sample: https://guyinacu.be/columnfromexamplessample  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: Answering your Power BI Premium Per User Questions
value.excerpt: There were a lot of good questions on our Power BI Premium Per User video. We are going to look at some of the questions that were asked and get you some answers!  PPU Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dEgR2_xi3mw  PPU FAQ: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/admin/service-premium-per-user-faq

value.title: Azure Active Directory and Power BI
value.excerpt: I take a look at how Power BI and Azure Active Directory interact.  Really it is more about Azure Active Directory and how do you get users into AAD.  This came up as I get pinged a lot from folks wondering how they can use AAD with Power BI, not necessarily realizing that it is already there.  http://blogs.technet.com/b/powerbisupport/archive/2015/09/15/azure-active-directory-and-power-bi.aspx

value.title: Best kept SECRET in Power BI??? You tell us!
value.excerpt: Have we found the best kept SECRET in Power BI? Adam saw this recently and was BLOWN away! Zooming in can help with presenting in business settings and anywhere else. Here are a few things you can use to make that presentation better with Power BI.  ZoomIt:  https://docs.microsoft.com/sysinternals/downloads/zoomit

value.title: Case of the Broken Power BI Incremental Refresh
value.excerpt: Are you using Power BI incremental refresh? Have you had it not work even though you set everything up? In this video, Patrick looks at a scenario where Power BI incremental refresh was broken. He then looks at a way to get Power BI incremental refresh working properly.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube

value.title: Column Profiling in Power BI Desktop

This can be useful when you want to use a single report tooltip for multiple Power BI visuals.  LET'S CONNECT! value.title: Fuzzy match / merging in Power BI Desktop (October 2018)

value.title: Handling deletes within Incremental Refresh in Power BI
value.excerpt: Are you using Incremental Refresh in Power BI? Are you stuck with how to handle deletes? Patrick has a great technique you can use to not only handle deletes, but also more easily handle updates with your partitions. value.title: How do you even use VertiPaq Analyzer with Power BI???

value.title: Inside Power Query reference queries for Power BI and Excel
value.excerpt: Chris Webb joins Patrick to look at what happens when you use reference queries for Power Query. This applies to both Power BI and Excel. Chris also looks at how change the behavior to make things a bit faster.  Data Privacy Blog: https://blog.crossjoin.co.uk/2018/12/27/data-privacy-settings-data-refresh-performance-power-bi-excel/

value.title: Install and configure Power BI Report Server (May 2017 Preview)
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at how to install and configure the May 2017 Preview of Power BI Report Server. Power BI Report Server has a new standalone install experience and this product allows for Power BI reports to be rendered in the web portal along with paginated reports.  This will get you started with

value.title: Introducing Power BI Premium Gen2
value.excerpt: At Microsoft Ignite, we found out about Power BI Premium Gen2. It's now available for you to use and WOW! It has changed the game! Adam walks you through what the changes are to help you level up.  Docs: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/admin/service-premium-what-is#power-bi-premium-generation-2-preview

value.title: Migrate your Paginated reports to Power BI
value.excerpt: Are your paginated reports still on-premises with either Power BI Report Server or SQL Server Reporting Services? Want to move them to Power BI? Patrick shows you how you can do that using the RDLMigration tool!  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/migrate-ssrs-reports-to-power-bi

value.title: 'OraOLEDB.Oracle' provider is not registered
value.excerpt: Highlights an issue that could occur when creating a Data Source within Power BI Admin Center.  Oracle Provider downloads -  64-bit Oracle Data Access Components (ODAC) http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/windows/downloads/index-090165.html  32-bit Oracle Data Access Components (ODAC) http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/dotnet/utilsoft-086879.html

value.title: Power BI and Microsoft Flow - Monitoring your data

This takes advantage of a streaming dataset and using the schedule recurrence in Microsoft Flow to trigger an action as Patrick wasn't using anything else to

value.title: Power BI Desktop And Role-Playing Dimensions: Can you do it?
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick talks about Power BI Desktop and role-playing dimensions. Can you even do this in Power BI Desktop? Patrick shows you why one particular way is not recommended as it will cause trouble. And then show you how you can use DAX within Power BI Desktop to take this to the next level.

value.title: Power BI DirectQuery and SQL Databases: A Conversation with Bob Ward

value.title: Power BI Drillthrough Updates
value.excerpt: Did you know there were Power BI drillthrough updates? In this video, Patrick looks at the drillthrough updates in Power BI Desktop. This includes Keep All Filters which will pass the filters on your parent page to the drillthrough page.   LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API
value.excerpt: The Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API allow you to quickly inventory your organization and manage workspaces and access. Forget the hastle of setting up the App registration within Azure Active Directory for API access, the Power BI PowerShell cmdlets take care of it for you. Just install and start

value.title: Power BI Publish to Web can be SCARY!?!
value.excerpt: Some don't realize that Power BI Publish to Web is not secure. Adam shows you that this is the case. It's a bit scary and there are other options to have secure embedding. value.title: Ragged Hierarchies in Analysis Services with Power BI and Excel
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at the ragged hierarchy problem within Excel and Power BI when you are pulling data from Analysis Services. value.title: SQL Service Principal Names
value.excerpt: A look at how the SQL SPN's should be formatted and how they get generated.  This was based on an older blog I had published and I still get a lot of questions on this.  What SPN do I use and how does it get there? - http://blogs.msdn.com/b/psssql/archive/2010/03/09/what-spn-do-i-use-and-how-does-it-get-there.aspx

value.title: STOP refreshing a single table at a time! (Power BI Desktop)
value.excerpt: Stop refreshing one table at a time! Also, don't wait for the entire data model to finish refreshing. Refresh multiple tables within Power BI Desktop.  Gilbert Q's Blog: https://www.fourmoo.com/2020/04/22/how-to-refresh-selected-not-all-tables-in-power-bi-desktop/  ðŸ“¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership
